method.name: GetDevices
method.tp:docstring: Get the list of network devices.

arg.name: devices
arg.tp:docstring: List of object paths of network devices known to the system.

method.name: ActivateDevice
method.tp:docstring: Activate a device using the supplied connection.

arg.name: service_name
arg.tp:docstring: The D-Bus service name of the settings service that provides this connection.

arg.name: connection
arg.tp:docstring: The connection to activate the devices with.

arg.name: specific_object
arg.tp:docstring: The path of a device-type-specific object this activation should use, for example a WiFi access point.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.NetworkManager.Error.ConnectionActivating
tp:error.tp:docstring: Another connection is already activating or the same connection is already active. FIXME: check if the error name is correct. FIXME: split into 2 errors?

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.NetworkManager.Error.ConnectionInvalid
tp:error.tp:docstring: The connection is invalid for this device.

method.name: Sleep
method.tp:docstring: Control the NetworkManager daemon's sleep state. When asleep, all interfaces that it manages are deactivated. When awake, devices are available to be activated.

arg.name: sleep
arg.tp:docstring: Indicates whether the NetworkManager daemon should sleep or wake.

property.name: WirelessEnabled
property.tp:docstring: Indicates if wireless is currently enabled or not.

property.name: WirelessHardwareEnabled
property.tp:docstring: Indicates if the wireless hardware is currently enabled, i.e. the state of the RF kill switch.

property.name: State
property.tp:docstring: The overall state of the NetworkManager daemon.

signal.name: DeviceAdded
signal.tp:docstring: A device was added to the system

arg.name: device_path
arg.tp:docstring: The object path of the newly added device.

signal.name: DeviceRemoved
signal.tp:docstring: A device was removed from the system, and is no longer available.

arg.name: device_path
arg.tp:docstring: The object path of the device that was just removed.

tp:enum.name: NM_STATE
tp:enum.tp:docstring: Describes the overall state of the daemon.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: The NetworkManager daemon is in an unknown state.
The NetworkManager daemon is asleep and all interfaces managed by it are inactive.
The NetworkManager daemon is connecting a device. FIXME: What does this mean when one device is active and another is connecting?

tp:struct.name: Active_Connection
tp:struct.tp:docstring: A struct representing an active connection, returned by GetActiveConnections on the NetworkManager interface.

tp:member.name: service_name
tp:member.tp:docstring: The D-Bus service name of the settings service that provides this connection.

tp:member.name: connection_path
tp:member.tp:docstring: Object path of the active connection

tp:member.name: specific_object
tp:member.tp:docstring: Object path of a device-type-specific object this connection uses, for example a specific WiFi access point.

tp:member.name: active_device_list
tp:member.tp:docstring: Array of object paths to the devices this connection is active on.

signal.name: StateChange
signal.tp:docstring: DEPRECATED. NetworkManager's state changed. Use the 'StateChanged' signal instead.

method.name: sleep
method.tp:docstring: DEPRECATED. Control the NetworkManager daemon's sleep state. When asleep, all interfaces that it manages are deactivated.

method.name: wake
method.tp:docstring: DEPRECATED. Control the NetworkManager daemon's sleep state. When awake, all known interfaces are available to be activated.

method.name: state
method.tp:docstring: DEPRECATED. The overall state of the NetworkManager daemon.
